alert.note: Alert for Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 18 at 10:55AM EDT until August 19 at 3:39AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shawsheen River at Andover. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Floodwaters inundate very lowest lying business parking lots off Route 114 in Lawrence and North Andover that are adjacent to the Shawsheen River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 28.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 30.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening to 27.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will rise to 28.1 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.6 feet on 04/01/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EDT.
